BSCCO_2212_LBNL.description: Level 3: Class for cable Bi-2212 fit developed in LBNL
BSCCO_2212_LBNL.title: BSCCO_2212_LBNL

Bordini.description: Level 3: Class for cable Bordini's Nb3Sn fit
Bordini.title: Bordini

Bottura.description: Level 3: Class for setting Bottura fit
Bottura.title: Bottura

noOfMPITasks.description: If integer, GetDP will be run in parallel using MPI. This is only valid if MPI is installed on the system and an MPI-enabled GetDP is used. If False, GetDP will be run in serial without invoking mpiexec.
noOfMPITasks.title: No. of tasks for MPI parallel run of GetDP

HTS_n_elem_width.description: Number of elements along HTS width (x-direction).
HTS_n_elem_width.title: Hts N Elem Width

HTS_n_elem_thickness.description: Number of elements through HTS thickness (y-direction).
HTS_n_elem_thickness.title: Hts N Elem Thickness

substrate_elem_scale.description: Element-count scale factor for substrate layer.
substrate_elem_scale.title: Substrate Elem Scale

substrate_side_progression.description: Progression factor for substrate vertical sides near the HTS side.
substrate_side_progression.title: Substrate Side Progression

silver_elem_scale.description: Element-count scale factor for silver layers.
silver_elem_scale.title: Silver Elem Scale

copper_elem_scale.description: Element-count scale factor for copper layers.
copper_elem_scale.title: Copper Elem Scale

air_boundary_mesh_size_ratio.description: Ratio of air outer-boundary mesh size to the HTS base size.
air_boundary_mesh_size_ratio.title: Air Boundary Mesh Size Ratio

bump_coef.description: Unified bump coefficient for transfinite horizontal edges. Used for both HTS and SilverTop when applying 'Bump' distributions. Values < 1 cluster nodes toward the edges; values > 1 cluster toward the center.
bump_coef.title: Bump Coef

pos_files.description: Entries controlling output of .pos files.If None or empty lists are given, no .pos files are written.Note that not all combinations of quantities and regions make sense.

CACCCPostprocPosFiles.description: Level 3: Class for post-pro .pos file requests

quantities.description: List of GetDP postprocessing quantities to write to .pos file. Examples of valid entry is: phi, h, b, j, jz, power
quantities.title: Quantities

regions.description: List of GetDP regions to write to .pos file postprocessing for. Examples of a valid entry is: Matrix, Filaments, Omega (full domain), OmegaC (conducting domain), OmegaCC (non conducting domain)
regions.title: Regions

CACCCPostprocPosFiles.title: CACCCPostprocPosFiles

conductor_name.description: Name of the conductor. Must match a conductor name in the conductors section of the input YAML-file.
conductor_name.title: Conductor Name

init_type.description: Type of initialization for the simulation. (i) 'virgin' is the default type, the initial magnetic field is zero,(ii) 'pos_file' is to initialize from the solution of another solution, given by the solution_to_init_from entry, and (iii) 'uniform_field' is to initialize at a uniform field, which will be the applied field at the initial time of the simulation. Note that the uniform_field option does not allow any non-zero transport current (initialization from pos_file is needed for this).
init_type.title: Init Type

solution_to_init_from.description: Name xxx of the solution from which the simulation should be initialized. The file last_magnetic_field.pos of folder Solution_xxx will be used for the initial solution.It must be in the Geometry_.../Mesh_.../ folder in which the Solution_xxx will be saved.
solution_to_init_from.title: Solution To Init From

relative_tolerance.description: Tolerance on the relative change of the power indicator for the convergence criterion (1e-6 is usually a safe choice).
relative_tolerance.title: Relative Tolerance

voltage_per_meter_stopping_criterion.description: If a non-zero value is given, the simulation will stop if the transport voltage per meter reaches this value (in absolute value).
voltage_per_meter_stopping_criterion.title: Voltage Per Meter Stopping Criterion

relaxation_factors.description: Use of relaxation factors to help convergence (automatic selection based on the lowest residual).
relaxation_factors.title: Relaxation Factors

CACCCSolveNumericalparametersPiecewise.description: Level 4: Numerical parameters corresponding to the piecewise source

time_to_simulate.description: Total time to simulate (s). Used for the piecewise source.
time_to_simulate.title: Time To Simulate

timesteps_per_time_to_simulate.description: If variable_max_timestep is False. Number of time steps (-) per period for the piecewise source.
timesteps_per_time_to_simulate.title: Timesteps Per Time To Simulate

force_stepping_at_times_piecewise_linear.description: If True, time-stepping will contain exactly the time instants that are inthe times_source_piecewise_linear list (to avoid truncation maximum applied field/current values).
force_stepping_at_times_piecewise_linear.title: Force Stepping At Times Piecewise Linear

variable_max_timestep.description: If False, the maximum time step is kept constant through the simulation. If True, it varies according to the piecewise definition.
variable_max_timestep.title: Variable Max Timestep

times_max_timestep_piecewise_linear.description: Time instants (s) defining the piecewise linear maximum time step.
times_max_timestep_piecewise_linear.title: Times Max Timestep Piecewise Linear

max_timestep_piecewise_linear.description: Maximum time steps (s) at the times_max_timestep_piecewise_linear. Above the limits, linear extrapolation of the last two values.
max_timestep_piecewise_linear.title: Max Timestep Piecewise Linear

CACCCSolveNumericalparametersPiecewise.title: CACCCSolveNumericalparametersPiecewise

CACCCSolveNumericalparametersSine.description: Level 4: Numerical parameters corresponding to the sine source

timesteps_per_period.description: Initial value for number of time steps (-) per period for the sine source.Determines the initial time step size.
timesteps_per_period.title: Timesteps Per Period

number_of_periods_to_simulate.description: Number of periods (-) to simulate for the sine source.
number_of_periods_to_simulate.title: Number Of Periods To Simulate

CACCCSolveNumericalparametersSine.title: CACCCSolveNumericalparametersSine

source_type.description: Time evolution of applied current and magnetic field. Supported options are: sine, piecewise.
source_type.title: Source Type

field_angle_with_respect_to_normal_direc.description: Angle of the source magnetic field with respect to the y-axis (normal to the tape) (degrees).
field_angle_with_respect_to_normal_direc.title: Field Angle With Respect To Normal Direction

CACCCSolveSourceparametersPiecewise.description: Level 4: Class for piecewise (linear) source parameters

source_csv_file.description: File name for the from_file source type defining the time evolution of current and field (in-phase).Multipliers are used for each of them.The file should contain two columns: 'time' (s) and 'value' (field/current (T/A)), with these headers.If this field is set, times, applied_fields_relative and transport_currents_relative are ignored.
source_csv_file.title: Source Csv File

times.description: Time instants (s) defining the piecewise linear sources.Used only if source_csv_file is not set.Can be scaled by time_multiplier.
times.title: Times

applied_fields_relative.description: Applied fields relative to multiplier applied_field_multiplier at the time instants 'times'.Used only if source_csv_file is not set.
applied_fields_relative.title: Applied Fields Relative

transport_currents_relative.description: Transport currents relative to multiplier transport_current_multiplier at the time instants 'times'.Used only if source_csv_file is not set.
transport_currents_relative.title: Transport Currents Relative

time_multiplier.description: Multiplier for the time values in times (scales the time values).Also used for the time values in the source_csv_file.
time_multiplier.title: Time Multiplier

applied_field_multiplier.description: Multiplier for the applied fields in applied_fields_relative.Also used for the values in the source_csv_file.
applied_field_multiplier.title: Applied Field Multiplier

transport_current_multiplier.description: Multiplier for the transport currents in transport_currents_relative.Also used for the values in the source_csv_file.
transport_current_multiplier.title: Transport Current Multiplier

CACCCSolveSourceparametersPiecewise.title: CACCCSolveSourceparametersPiecewise

CACCCSolveSourceparametersSine.description: Level 4: Class for Sine source parameters
CACCCSolveSourceparametersSine.title: CACCCSolveSourceparametersSine

CACRutherfordExcitationCoils.description: Level 3: Class for Input/Output settings for the cable geometry

centers.description: List of center points for the centers of the excitations coil regions. Each center point is a list of three elements for x, y, and z (=0) coordinates.
centers.title: Centers

widths.description: List of widths of the excitation coil regions.
widths.title: Widths

heights.description: List of heights of the excitation coil regions.
heights.title: Heights

CACRutherfordExcitationCoils.title: CACRutherfordExcitationCoils

CACRutherfordGeometry.description: Level 2: Class for cable geometry parameters

point_snap_tolerance_relative_to_strand_.description: The maximum distance between two points, relative to the strand diameter, where the points are considered equal (i.e. they 'snap' together).
point_snap_tolerance_relative_to_strand_.title: Point Snap Tolerance Relative To Strand Diameter

min_roundness_factor.description: Minimum roundness is the ratio between the min -and max radius for the corner circle-arcs.
min_roundness_factor.title: Min Roundness Factor

coating_corner_arc_radius.description: Radius of the corner arcs of the coating (m).
coating_corner_arc_radius.title: Coating Corner Arc Radius

keep_strand_area.description: If True, the area of the strands are determined by the area of the strand described in 'conductors'. If False, the area of the strands are determined based on the cable geometry inputs.
keep_strand_area.title: Keep Strand Area

CACRutherfordGeometry.title: CACRutherfordGeometry

CACRutherfordIOsettings.description: Level 3: Class for Input/Output settings for the cable geometry
CACRutherfordIOsettings.title: CACRutherfordIOsettings

CACRutherfordIOsettingsLoad.description: Level 3: Class for Input/Output settings for the cable geometry

load_from_yaml.description: True to load cable geometry from yaml-file, false to create the geometry.
load_from_yaml.title: Load From Yaml

filename.description: Name of the file from which to load the cable geometry.
filename.title: Filename

CACRutherfordIOsettingsLoad.title: CACRutherfordIOsettingsLoad

CACRutherfordIOsettingsSave.description: Level 3: Class for Input/Output settings for the cable geometry

save_to_yaml.description: True to save cable geometry to yaml-file, false to not save the geometry.
save_to_yaml.title: Save To Yaml

filename.description: Name of the file to which to save the cable geometry.
filename.title: Filename

CACRutherfordIOsettingsSave.title: CACRutherfordIOsettingsSave

scaling_global.description: Global scaling factor for mesh size.
scaling_global.title: Scaling Global

strand_mesh_size_ratio.description: Mesh size ratio for the strand, relative to the strand diameter.
strand_mesh_size_ratio.title: Strand Mesh Size Ratio

coating_mesh_size_ratio.description: Mesh size ratio for the coating, relative to the strand diameter.
coating_mesh_size_ratio.title: Coating Mesh Size Ratio

air_boundary_mesh_size_ratio.description: Mesh size ratio for the air boundary, relative to the strand diameter.
air_boundary_mesh_size_ratio.title: Air Boundary Mesh Size Ratio

generate_pos_files.description: Set True to generate .pos-files during post-processing
generate_pos_files.title: Generate Pos Files

compute_current_per_filament.description: Computes current in every filament, with decomposition into magnetization and transport current.
compute_current_per_filament.title: Compute Current Per Filament

save_last_current_density.description: Saves the last current density field solution (out-of-plane) in the file given as a string. The '.pos' extension will be appended to it. Nothing is done if None. This can be for using the current density as an initial condition (but not implemented yet).
save_last_current_density.title: Save Last Current Density

save_last_magnetic_field.description: Saves the last magnetic field solution (in-plane) in the file given as a string. The '.pos' extension will be appended to it. Nothing is done if None. This is for using the magnetic field as an initial condition for another resolution.
save_last_magnetic_field.title: Save Last Magnetic Field

CACRutherfordPostprocBatchpostproc.description: Level 3: Class for batch post-processing settings

postProc_csv.description: Name of the .csv file for post-processing (without file extension). This file specifies the simulations to be post-processed. The file is structured into three columns, specifying the folder names to access the simulation results: 'input.run.geometry', 'input.run.mesh' and 'input.run.solve'. Each row corresponds to a simulation to be post-processed.
postProc_csv.title: Postproc Csv

output_folder.description: Batch post-processing creates a folder with the given name in the output directory, where all the plots are saved.
output_folder.title: Output Folder

CACRutherfordPostprocBatchpostproc.title: CACRutherfordPostprocBatchpostproc

CACRutherfordPostprocBatchpostprocFilter.description: Level 4: Field for filtering simulations based on simulation parameters for batch post-processing

apply_filter.description: Set True to filter simulations by parameters from the input YAML-file.
apply_filter.title: Apply Filter

filter_criterion.description: Criterion used to filter simulations based on simulation parameters. For example will '<<solve.source_parameters.sine.frequency>> > 100' disregard simulations done with frequencies lower than 100Hz.
filter_criterion.title: Filter Criterion

CACRutherfordPostprocBatchpostprocFilter.title: CACRutherfordPostprocBatchpostprocFilter

CACRutherfordPostprocBatchpostprocLossMa.description: Level 4: Class with settings for generating loss maps

produce_loss_map.description: Set True to produce a loss map.
produce_loss_map.title: Produce Loss Map

save_plot.description: Set True to save the plot.
save_plot.title: Save Plot

x_val.description: Parameter to be plotted on the x-axis. This field corresponds to a parameter in the input YAML-file. E.g. 'solve.source_parameters.sine.frequency' will plot the loss map for different frequencies.
x_val.title: X Val

y_val.description: Parameter to be plotted on the y-axis. This field corresponds to a parameter in the input YAML-file. E.g. 'solve.source_parameters.sine.field_amplitude' will plot the loss map for different applied field amplitudes.
y_val.title: Y Val

x_steps.description: Number of steps on the x-axis.
x_steps.title: X Steps

y_steps.description: Number of steps on the y-axis.
y_steps.title: Y Steps

loss_type.description: Type of loss to be plotted. Supported options are: TotalLoss, FilamentLoss, CouplingLoss, EddyLoss.
loss_type.title: Loss Type

x_log.description: Set True to plot x-axis in log-scale.
x_log.title: X Log

y_log.description: Set True to plot y-axis in log-scale.
y_log.title: Y Log

loss_log.description: Set True to plot loss in log-scale.
loss_log.title: Loss Log

show_datapoints.description: Set True to show markers for all the datapoints in the loss map.
show_datapoints.title: Show Datapoints

show_loss_type_dominance_contour.description: Set True to plot a contour curve separating regions where different loss types dominate.
show_loss_type_dominance_contour.title: Show Loss Type Dominance Contour

CACRutherfordPostprocBatchpostprocLossMa.title: CACRutherfordPostprocBatchpostprocLossMap

CACRutherfordPostprocBatchpostprocLossMa.description: Level 5: Class with settings for plotting a cross-section of the loss map.

plot_cross_section.description: Set True to plot a cross-section of the loss map.
plot_cross_section.title: Plot Cross Section

save_plot.description: Set True to save the plot.
save_plot.title: Save Plot

axis_to_cut.description: Axis to cut for the cross-section.
axis_to_cut.title: Axis To Cut

cut_value.description: Value of the axis to cut for the cross-section.
cut_value.title: Cut Value

title.description: Title of the plot. The placeholder <<cut_value>> can be used to indicate the value of the cut axis.
title.title: Title

CACRutherfordPostprocBatchpostprocLossMa.title: CACRutherfordPostprocBatchpostprocLossMapCrossSection

CACRutherfordPostprocBatchpostprocLossMa.description: Level 5: Class with settings for animating a cross-section sweep of the loss map along one axis.

animate_cross_section_sweep.description: Set True to animate a cross-section sweep of the loss map along one axis.
animate_cross_section_sweep.title: Animate Cross Section Sweep

save_plot.description: Set True to save the animation.
save_plot.title: Save Plot

axis_to_sweep.description: Axis to sweep for the animation.
axis_to_sweep.title: Axis To Sweep

title.description: Title of the plot. Use <<sweep_value>> to indicate the value of the sweep axis.
title.title: Title

CACRutherfordPostprocBatchpostprocLossMa.title: CACRutherfordPostprocBatchpostprocLossMapCrossSectionSweep

produce_plot2d.description: Set True to produce a 2D plot.
produce_plot2d.title: Produce Plot2D

combined_plot.description: Set True to produce a combined plot for all simulations. If False, a separate plot is produced for each simulation.
combined_plot.title: Combined Plot

save_plot.description: Set True to save the plot.
save_plot.title: Save Plot

x_val.description: Value to be plotted on the x-axis. Parameters in the input YAML-file and class-variables from the plotter 'SimulationData' class can be accessed trough the notation << . >>. E.g. '<<solve.source_parameters.sine.frequency>>' will create a 2D plot with frequency on the x-axis. '<<time>>' will create a plot with time on the x-axis.
x_val.title: X Val

y_vals.description: List of values to be plotted on the y-axis. Parameters in the input YAML-file and class-variables from the plotter 'SimulationData' class can be accessed trough the notation << . >>. E.g. total AC-loss per cycle can be accessed as ['<<total_power_per_cycle['TotalLoss_dyn']>>'].
y_vals.title: Y Vals

labels.description: List of labels for the plot. Each label corresponding to a value in y_val.
labels.title: Labels

x_log.description: Set True to plot x-axis in log-scale.
x_log.title: X Log

y_log.description: Set True to plot y-axis in log-scale.
y_log.title: Y Log

CACRutherfordPostprocBatchpostprocSort.description: Level 4: Field for sorting simulations based on simulation parameters for batch post-processing

sort_key.description: Criterion used to sort simulations based on simulation parameters. For example will 'sd.total_power_per_cycle['TotalLoss'] sort simulations based on the total loss.
sort_key.title: Sort Key

CACRutherfordPostprocBatchpostprocSort.title: CACRutherfordPostprocBatchpostprocSort

remove_pre_file.description: Set True to remove the .pre-file after post-processing, to save disk space.
remove_pre_file.title: Remove Pre File

remove_res_file.description: Set True to remove the .res-file after post-processing, to save disk space.
remove_res_file.title: Remove Res File

remove_msh_file.description: Set True to remove the .msh-file after post-processing, to save disk space.
remove_msh_file.title: Remove Msh File

CACRutherfordPostprocPlotInstPower.description: Level 3: Class with settings for generating plots of instantaneous power

show.description: Creates a plot for the calculated instantaneous AC loss (W/m) as a function of time (s).
show.title: Show

save.description: Set True to save the plot.
save.title: Save

CACRutherfordPostprocPlotInstPower.title: CACRutherfordPostprocPlotInstPower

CACRutherfordSolveFormulationparameters.description: Level 3: Class for finite element formulation parameters

stranded_strands.description: Are the strands solved as 'stranded conductors', i.e., with fixed source current density, and no eddy current effect? Put to True if we solve for homogenized strands.
stranded_strands.title: Stranded Strands

rohm.description: Do we use the ROHM model to describe the stranded strand magnetization? This is only relevant with stranded strands, but can be used without (without much meaning). If fase, solves with permeability mu0.
rohm.title: Rohm

rohf.description: Do we use the ROHF model to describe the stranded strand voltage and inductance? This is only possible with stranded strands. If stranded_strands=false, rohf is considered false as well.
rohf.title: Rohf

CACRutherfordSolveFormulationparameters.title: CACRutherfordSolveFormulationparameters

CACRutherfordSolveFrequencydomainsolver.description: Level 3: Class for frequency domain solver settings

enable.description: Set True to enable the frequency domain solver.
enable.title: Enable

CACRutherfordSolveFrequencydomainsolver.title: CACRutherfordSolveFrequencydomainsolver

CACRutherfordSolveFrequencydomainsolverF.description: Level 4: Class for frequency sweep settings

run_sweep.description: Set True to run a frequency sweep (logarithmic).
run_sweep.title: Run Sweep

number_of_frequencies.description: Number of frequencies in the sweep.
number_of_frequencies.title: Number Of Frequencies

CACRutherfordSolveFrequencydomainsolverF.title: CACRutherfordSolveFrequencydomainsolverFrequencysweep

superconductor_n_value.description: n value for the power law (-), used in current sharing law.
superconductor_n_value.title: Superconductor N Value

superconductor_Ic.description: Critical current of the strands (A) (e.g., typical value at T=1.9K and B=10T). Will be taken as a constant as in this model the field dependence is not included (the main purpose of the model is to verify the more efficient Homogenized Conductor model). Including field-dependence could be done but is not trivial because is mixes global and local quantities in this Rutherford model with strand discretized individually as stranded conductors.
superconductor_Ic.title: Superconductor Ic

matrix_resistance.description: Resistance of the matrix (per unit length) (Ohm/m) for the current sharing law. Kept constant in this model (for simplicity).
matrix_resistance.title: Matrix Resistance

rho_coating.description: Resistivity of coating domain outside of the strands (Ohm.m).
rho_coating.title: Rho Coating

rho_strands.description: Resistivity of strands, when modelled as massive conductors (Ohm.m).
rho_strands.title: Rho Strands

noOfMPITasks.description: If integer, GetDP will be run in parallel using MPI. This is only valid if MPI is installed on the system and an MPI-enabled GetDP is used. If False, GetDP will be run in serial without invoking mpiexec.
noOfMPITasks.title: No. of tasks for MPI parallel run of GetDP

init_from_pos_file.description: Do we initialize the solution at a non-zero field.
init_from_pos_file.title: Init From Pos File

pos_file_to_init_from.description: Name of .pos file for magnetic field (A/m) from which the solution should be initialized. Should be in the Geometry_xxx/Mesh_xxx/ folder in which the Solution_xxx will be saved.
pos_file_to_init_from.title: Pos File To Init From

CACRutherfordSolveNumericalparametersPie.description: Level 4: Numerical parameters corresponding to the piecewise source

time_to_simulate.description: Total time to simulate (s). Used for the piecewise source.
time_to_simulate.title: Time To Simulate

timesteps_per_time_to_simulate.description: If variable_max_timestep is False. Number of time steps (-) per period for the piecewise source.
timesteps_per_time_to_simulate.title: Timesteps Per Time To Simulate

force_stepping_at_times_piecewise_linear.description: If True, time-stepping will contain exactly the time instants that are in the times_source_piecewise_linear list (to avoid truncation maximum applied field/current values).
force_stepping_at_times_piecewise_linear.title: Force Stepping At Times Piecewise Linear

variable_max_timestep.description: If False, the maximum time step is kept constant through the simulation. If True, it varies according to the piecewise definition.
variable_max_timestep.title: Variable Max Timestep

times_max_timestep_piecewise_linear.description: Time instants (s) defining the piecewise linear maximum time step.
times_max_timestep_piecewise_linear.title: Times Max Timestep Piecewise Linear

max_timestep_piecewise_linear.description: Maximum time steps (s) at the times_max_timestep_piecewise_linear. Above the limits, linear extrapolation of the last two values.
max_timestep_piecewise_linear.title: Max Timestep Piecewise Linear

CACRutherfordSolveNumericalparametersPie.title: CACRutherfordSolveNumericalparametersPiecewise

CACRutherfordSolveNumericalparametersSin.description: Level 4: Numerical parameters corresponding to the sine source

timesteps_per_period.description: Initial value for number of time steps (-) per period for the sine source. Determines the initial time step size.
timesteps_per_period.title: Timesteps Per Period

number_of_periods_to_simulate.description: Number of periods (-) to simulate for the sine source.
number_of_periods_to_simulate.title: Number Of Periods To Simulate

CACRutherfordSolveNumericalparametersSin.title: CACRutherfordSolveNumericalparametersSine

source_type.description: Time evolution of applied current and magnetic field. Supported options are: sine, sine_with_DC, piecewise_linear, from_list.
source_type.title: Source Type

parallel_resistor.description: If False, no parallel resistor and the current source directly and only feeds the cable. If True, a resistor is placed in parallel with the cable, with a default resistance of 1 Ohm. If float (cannot be zero), this defines the value of the resistance.
parallel_resistor.title: Resistor parallel to the cable

boundary_condition_type.description: Boundary condition type. Supported options are: Natural, Essential. Do not use essential boundary condition with induced currents.
boundary_condition_type.title: Boundary Condition Type

enable.description: Are the excitation coils used in the model? (they can exist in the geometry and mesh but be ignored at the solution stage)
enable.title: Enable

source_csv_file.description: The file should contain a first column with 'time' (s) and one additional column per excitation coil with 'value', which is the TOTAL current (A) per coil (with appropriate sign).
source_csv_file.title: Source Csv File

CACRutherfordSolveSourceparametersPiecew.description: Level 4: Class for piecewise (linear) source parameters

source_csv_file.description: File name for the from_file source type defining the time evolution of current and field (in-phase). Multipliers are used for each of them. The file should contain two columns: 'time' (s) and 'value' (field/current (T/A)), with these headers. If this field is set, times, applied_fields_relative and transport_currents_relative are ignored.
source_csv_file.title: Source Csv File

times.description: Time instants (s) defining the piecewise linear sources. Used only if source_csv_file is not set. Can be scaled by time_multiplier.
times.title: Times

applied_fields_relative.description: Applied fields relative to multiplier applied_field_multiplier at the time instants 'times'. Used only if source_csv_file is not set.
applied_fields_relative.title: Applied Fields Relative

transport_currents_relative.description: Transport currents relative to multiplier transport_current_multiplier at the time instants 'times'. Used only if source_csv_file is not set.
transport_currents_relative.title: Transport Currents Relative

time_multiplier.description: Multiplier for the time values in times (scales the time values). Also used for the time values in the source_csv_file.
time_multiplier.title: Time Multiplier

applied_field_multiplier.description: Multiplier for the applied fields in applied_fields_relative. Also used for the values in the source_csv_file.
applied_field_multiplier.title: Applied Field Multiplier

transport_current_multiplier.description: Multiplier for the transport currents in transport_currents_relative. Also used for the values in the source_csv_file.
transport_current_multiplier.title: Transport Current Multiplier

field_angle.description: Angle of the sine field direction, with respect to the x-axis (degrees).
field_angle.title: Field Angle

CACRutherfordSolveSourceparametersPiecew.title: CACRutherfordSolveSourceparametersPiecewise

CACRutherfordSolveSourceparametersSine.description: Level 4: Class for Sine source parameters

field_angle.description: Angle of the sine field direction, with respect to the x-axis (degrees).
field_angle.title: Field Angle

CACRutherfordSolveSourceparametersSine.title: CACRutherfordSolveSourceparametersSine

CACRutherfordSolveSourceparametersSineSu.description: Level 5: Class for superimposed DC field or current parameters for the sine source

field_magnitude.description: DC field magnitude (T) (direction along y-axis). Solution must be initialized with a non-zero field solution stored in a .pos file if non-zero DC field is used.
field_magnitude.title: Field Magnitude

current_magnitude.description: DC current magnitude (A). Solution must be initialized with a non-zero field solution stored in a .pos file if non-zero DC current is used.
current_magnitude.title: Current Magnitude

CACRutherfordSolveSourceparametersSineSu.title: CACRutherfordSolveSourceparametersSineSuperimposedDC

CACStrandGeometry.description: Level 2: Class for strand geometry parameters

hexagonal_filaments.description: Field for specifying the shape of the filaments. True for hexagonal, False for circular.
hexagonal_filaments.title: Hexagonal Filaments

hexagonal_holes.description: Field for specifying the shape of the filament holes. True for hexagonal, False for circular.
hexagonal_holes.title: Hexagonal Holes

filament_circular_distribution.description: Field for specifying the geometrical distribution of the filaments. Set True to distribute the filaments in a circular pattern and False to distribute them in a hexagonal pattern.
filament_circular_distribution.title: Filament Circular Distribution

air_radius.description: Radius of the circular numerical air region (m).
air_radius.title: Air Radius

type.description: Type of model geometry which will be generated. Supported options are: strand_only, periodic_squarestrand_only models the strand in an circular air domain (natural boundary condition)periodic_square models the strand in an square air domain (periodic boundary condition)coil models a single coil winding in open space (uses hybrid boundary conditions)
type.title: Type

coil_radius.description: used in geometry type 'coil' to determine the distance from strand center to mirroring plane (m). Should always be bigger than strand radius.
coil_radius.title: Coil Radius

rotate_angle.description: Rotates strand geometry by specified angle in deg counterclockwise around the z axis and x=0 and y=0
rotate_angle.title: Rotate Angle

CACStrandGeometry.title: CACStrandGeometry

CACStrandGeometryIOsettings.description: Level 2: Class for Input/Output settings for the cable geometry
CACStrandGeometryIOsettings.title: CACStrandGeometryIOsettings

CACStrandIOsettingsLoad.description: Level 3: Class for Input/Output settings for the cable geometry

load_from_yaml.description: True to load the geometry from a YAML file, false to generate the geometry.
load_from_yaml.title: Load From Yaml

filename.description: Name of the YAML file from which to load the geometry.
filename.title: Filename

CACStrandIOsettingsLoad.title: CACStrandIOsettingsLoad

CACStrandIOsettingsSave.description: Level 3: Class for Input/Output settings for the cable geometry

save_to_yaml.description: True to save the geometry to a YAML-file, false to not save the geometry.
save_to_yaml.title: Save To Yaml

filename.description: Name of the output geometry YAML file.
filename.title: Filename

CACStrandIOsettingsSave.title: CACStrandIOsettingsSave

scaling_global.description: Global scaling factor for mesh size.
scaling_global.title: Scaling Global

max_mesh_size_ratio.description: Mesh size at the outer boundary of the air region, relative to the filament radius. E.g. 10 means that the mesh size is 10 times the filament radius.
max_mesh_size_ratio.title: Max Mesh Size Ratio

boundary_mesh_size_ratio.description: Mesh size at filament boundaries, relative to the radius of the filaments. E.g. 0.1 means that the mesh size is 0.1 times the filament radius.
boundary_mesh_size_ratio.title: Boundary Mesh Size Ratio

center_mesh_size_ratio.description: Mesh size at filament center, relative to the radius of the filaments. E.g. 0.1 means that the mesh size is 0.1 times the filament radius.
center_mesh_size_ratio.title: Center Mesh Size Ratio

amplitude_dependent_scaling.description: Amplitude dependent scaling uses the field amplitude to approximate the field penetration distance in the filaments to alter the filament mesh. If the field penetration distance is low (i.e. for low field amplitudes) this feature increases mesh density in the region where the field is expected to penetrate, and decreases the mesh resolution in the region where the field does not penetrate.
amplitude_dependent_scaling.title: Amplitude Dependent Scaling

field_penetration_depth_scaling_factor.description: Scaling factor for the estimate of the field penetration depth, used for amplitude dependent scaling.
field_penetration_depth_scaling_factor.title: Field Penetration Depth Scaling Factor

desired_elements_in_field_penetration_re.description: Desired number of elements in the field penetration region. This parameter is used for amplitude dependent scaling, and determines the number of elements in the region where the field is expected to penetrate.
desired_elements_in_field_penetration_re.title: Desired Elements In Field Penetration Region

mesh_size_matrix_ratio_inner.description: Mesh size at the matrix center, relative to the filament radius.
mesh_size_matrix_ratio_inner.title: Mesh Size Matrix Ratio Inner

mesh_size_matrix_ratio_middle.description: Mesh size at the matrix middle partition, relative to the filament radius.
mesh_size_matrix_ratio_middle.title: Mesh Size Matrix Ratio Middle

mesh_size_matrix_ratio_outer.description: Mesh size at the matrix outer boundary, relative to the filament radius.
mesh_size_matrix_ratio_outer.title: Mesh Size Matrix Ratio Outer

interpolation_distance_from_filaments_ra.description: The mesh size is interpolated from the filament boundaries into the matrix, over a given distance. This parameter determines the distance over which the mesh size is interpolated.
interpolation_distance_from_filaments_ra.title: Interpolation Distance From Filaments Ratio

rate_dependent_scaling_matrix.description: Rate dependent scaling uses the expected skin depth in the matrix to determine the matrix mesh. If the skin depth is low (i.e. for high frequencies) this feature increases mesh density in the region where the current is expected to flow, while decreasing the mesh resolution in the region where the current is not expected to flow.
rate_dependent_scaling_matrix.title: Rate Dependent Scaling Matrix

skindepth_scaling_factor.description: Scaling factor for the estimate of the skin depth, used for rate dependent scaling.
skindepth_scaling_factor.title: Skindepth Scaling Factor

desired_elements_in_skindepth.description: Desired number of elements in the skin depth region. This parameter is used for rate dependent scaling, and determines the number of elements in the region where the current is expected to flow.
desired_elements_in_skindepth.title: Desired Elements In Skindepth

force_center_symmetry.description: This option can be set in strands without center filament to enforce a cross of symmetric nodes in the center of the strand mesh - used within Glock thesis.
force_center_symmetry.title: Force Center Symmetry

pos_files.description: Entries controlling output of .pos files. If None or empty lists are given, no .pos files are written. Note that not all combinations of quantities and regions make sense.

compute_current_per_filament.description: Computes current in every filament, with decomposition into magnetization and transport current.
compute_current_per_filament.title: Compute Current Per Filament

output_folder.description: Batch post-processing creates a folder with the given name in the output directory, where all the plots are saved.
output_folder.title: Output Folder

generate_report.description: Generates a PDF report including all postprocessing graphs. File is saved in the output_folder.
generate_report.title: Generate Report

CACStrandPostprocBatchpostproc.description: Level 3: Class for batch post-processing settings

simulations_csv.description: Name of the .csv file for post-processing (without file extension). This file specifies the simulations to be post-processed. The file is structured into three columns, specifying the folder names to access the simulation results: 'input.run.geometry', 'input.run.mesh' and 'input.run.solve'. Each row corresponds to a simulation to be post-processed.
simulations_csv.title: Simulations Csv

fluxmodels_csv.description: Name of the .csv file for post-processing (without file extension). This file specifies the fluxmodels to be post-processed. The file is structured into three columns, specifying the folder names to access the simulation results: 'input.run.geometry', 'input.run.mesh' and 'input.run.solve'. Each row corresponds to a simulation to be post-processed.
fluxmodels_csv.title: Fluxmodels Csv

CACStrandPostprocBatchpostproc.title: CACStrandPostprocBatchpostproc

CACStrandPostprocBatchpostprocFilter.description: Level 4: Field for filtering simulations based on simulation parameters for batch post-processing

apply_filter.description: Set True to filter simulations by parameters from the input YAML-file.
apply_filter.title: Apply Filter

filter_criterion.description: Criterion used to filter simulations based on simulation parameters. For example will '<<solve.source_parameters.sine.frequency>> > 100' disregard simulations done with frequencies lower than 100Hz.
filter_criterion.title: Filter Criterion

CACStrandPostprocBatchpostprocFilter.title: CACStrandPostprocBatchpostprocFilter

CACStrandPostprocBatchpostprocLossMap.description: Level 4: Class with settings for generating loss maps

produce_loss_map.description: Set True to produce a loss map.
produce_loss_map.title: Produce Loss Map

save_plot.description: Set True to save the plot.
save_plot.title: Save Plot

x_val.description: Parameter to be plotted on the x-axis. This field corresponds to a parameter in the input YAML-file. E.g. 'solve.source_parameters.sine.frequency' will plot the loss map for different frequencies.
x_val.title: X Val

y_val.description: Parameter to be plotted on the y-axis. This field corresponds to a parameter in the input YAML-file. E.g. 'solve.source_parameters.sine.field_amplitude' will plot the loss map for different applied field amplitudes.
y_val.title: Y Val

x_steps.description: Number of steps on the x-axis.
x_steps.title: X Steps

y_steps.description: Number of steps on the y-axis.
y_steps.title: Y Steps

loss_type.description: Type of loss to be plotted. Supported options are: TotalLoss, FilamentLoss, CouplingLoss, EddyLoss.
loss_type.title: Loss Type

x_log.description: Set True to plot x-axis in log-scale.
x_log.title: X Log

y_log.description: Set True to plot y-axis in log-scale.
y_log.title: Y Log

loss_log.description: Set True to plot loss in log-scale.
loss_log.title: Loss Log

show_datapoints.description: Set True to show markers for all the datapoints in the loss map.
show_datapoints.title: Show Datapoints

show_loss_type_dominance_contour.description: Set True to plot a contour curve separating regions where different loss types dominate.
show_loss_type_dominance_contour.title: Show Loss Type Dominance Contour

CACStrandPostprocBatchpostprocLossMap.title: CACStrandPostprocBatchpostprocLossMap

CACStrandPostprocBatchpostprocLossMapCro.description: Level 5: Class with settings for plotting a cross-section of the loss map.

plot_cross_section.description: Set True to plot a cross-section of the loss map.
plot_cross_section.title: Plot Cross Section

save_plot.description: Set True to save the plot.
save_plot.title: Save Plot

axis_to_cut.description: Axis to cut for the cross-section.
axis_to_cut.title: Axis To Cut

cut_value.description: Value of the axis to cut for the cross-section.
cut_value.title: Cut Value

title.description: Title of the plot. The placeholder <<cut_value>> can be used to indicate the value of the cut axis.
title.title: Title

CACStrandPostprocBatchpostprocLossMapCro.title: CACStrandPostprocBatchpostprocLossMapCrossSection

CACStrandPostprocBatchpostprocLossMapCro.description: Level 5: Class with settings for animating a cross-section sweep of the loss map along one axis.

animate_cross_section_sweep.description: Set True to animate a cross-section sweep of the loss map along one axis.
animate_cross_section_sweep.title: Animate Cross Section Sweep

save_plot.description: Set True to save the animation.
save_plot.title: Save Plot

axis_to_sweep.description: Axis to sweep for the animation.
axis_to_sweep.title: Axis To Sweep

title.description: Title of the plot. Use <<sweep_value>> to indicate the value of the sweep axis.
title.title: Title

CACStrandPostprocBatchpostprocLossMapCro.title: CACStrandPostprocBatchpostprocLossMapCrossSectionSweep

produce_plot2d.description: Set True to produce a 2D plot.
produce_plot2d.title: Produce Plot2D

combined_plot.description: Set True to produce a combined plot for all simulations. If False, a separate plot is produced for each simulation.
combined_plot.title: Combined Plot

save_pgfdata.description: Set True to export the plot data in pgfplot readable .txt format stored in output_folder. Currently only supports combined plots.
save_pgfdata.title: Save Pgfdata

save_plot.description: Set True to save the plot.
save_plot.title: Save Plot

x_val.description: Value to be plotted on the x-axis. Parameters in the input YAML-file and class-variables from the plotter 'SimulationData' class can be accessed trough dot notation 'simulation.' E.g. 'simulation.f' will create a 2D plot with sine source frequency on the x-axis. 'simulation.time' will create a plot with time on the x-axis.
x_val.title: X Val

y_vals.description: List of values to be plotted on the y-axis. Parameters in the input YAML-file and class-variables from the plotter 'SimulationData' class can be accessed trough dot notation 'simulation.' E.g. total AC-loss per cycle can be accessed as ['simulation.total_power_per_cycle['TotalLoss_dyn']'].
y_vals.title: Y Vals

y_val_fluxmodel.description: Attribute of the 'ROHFmodel' class which is plotted on the y-axis. Access via dot notation with 'fluxmodel.' and 'simulation.' E.g. ROHF computed flux - 'fluxmodel.compute(I=simulation.I_transport,time=simulation.time)[0]'
y_val_fluxmodel.title: Y Val Fluxmodel

reference_vals.description: reference values as set of two list [xvals, yvals] which will be plotted in the combined plot (For reference curves)
reference_vals.title: Reference Vals

reference_label.description: label text for the reference data in the plot legend
reference_label.title: Reference Label

labels.description: List of labels for the plot. Each label corresponding to a value in y_val.
labels.title: Labels

x_log.description: Set True to plot x-axis in log-scale.
x_log.title: X Log

y_log.description: Set True to plot y-axis in log-scale.
y_log.title: Y Log

CACStrandPostprocBatchpostprocROHFgrid.description: Level 4: Class with settings to perform actions on a ROHF model based on a grid of simulations.

produce_error_map.description: Set True to produce a error map of the definced error_type. If the fit_rohf option is enabled it will compute the map for the new ROHF model ignoring everything in the fluxmodel.csv.
produce_error_map.title: Produce Error Map

interpolate_error_map.description: Interpolate colormap linear between the computed values (graphical purposes)
interpolate_error_map.title: Interpolate Error Map

error_type.description: realtive error metric displayed by the map. Options: pc_loss, flux, dyn_loss
error_type.title: Error Type

fit_rohf.description: Fit a ROHF model on the simulation grid given in the simulation.csv
fit_rohf.title: Fit Rohf

fit_rohf_N.description: Number of ROHF cells to use for the fit. Default is 7.
fit_rohf_N.title: Fit Rohf N

fit_rohf_tausweep_IIC.description: I/Ic ratio used to fit the ratedependence parameters (taus).
fit_rohf_tausweep_IIC.title: Fit Rohf Tausweep Iic

CACStrandPostprocBatchpostprocROHFgrid.title: CACStrandPostprocBatchpostprocROHFgrid

CACStrandPostprocBatchpostprocSort.description: Level 4: Field for sorting simulations based on simulation parameters for batch post-processing

sort_key.description: Criterion used to sort simulations based on simulation parameters. For example will 'sd.total_power_per_cycle['TotalLoss'] sort simulations based on the total loss.
sort_key.title: Sort Key

CACStrandPostprocBatchpostprocSort.title: CACStrandPostprocBatchpostprocSort

remove_pre_file.description: Set True to remove the .pre-file after post-processing, to save disk space.
remove_pre_file.title: Remove Pre File

remove_res_file.description: Set True to remove the .res-file after post-processing, to save disk space.
remove_res_file.title: Remove Res File

remove_msh_file.description: Set True to remove the .msh-file after post-processing, to save disk space.
remove_msh_file.title: Remove Msh File

CACStrandPostprocPlotFlux.description:
Level 3: Class with settings flux related plots and the related - reduced order hysteretic flux (ROHF) model.
The ROHF model can either be initialized from a predefined parameter file or freshly fitted on the solution with a given number_of_cells and kappa_spacing_type (will not be rate dependent).

rohf_file.description: Name of a .txt file in the geometry folder containing tau, kappa and alpha values. The file has to be structured into three columns (separated by whitespaces) with the preliminary header-row 'taus kappas alphas'. Each row corresponds to one cell of the multicell ROHF model.
rohf_file.title: Rohf File

rohf_N.description: Total number of cells (N) for the ROHF model. If a parameter_file_name is given this option will be disregarded in favour of the parameterfile definitions.
rohf_N.title: Rohf N

rohf_kappa_spacing.description: Spacing strategy for the N kappa values of the ROHF model. Options: 'linear', 'log', 'invlog' if left blank it will set the kappa interval based on a error minimization. If a parameter_file_name is given this option will be disregarded in favour of the parameterfile definitions.
rohf_kappa_spacing.title: Rohf Kappa Spacing

CACStrandPostprocPlotFlux.title: CACStrandPostprocPlotFlux

CACStrandPostprocPlotInstPower.description: Level 3: Class with settings for generating plots of instantaneous power

show.description: Creates a plot for the calculated instantaneous AC loss (W/m) as a function of time (s).
show.title: Show

save.description: Set True to save the plot.
save.title: Save

CACStrandPostprocPlotInstPower.title: CACStrandPostprocPlotInstPower

quantities.description: List of GetDP postprocessing quantity to write to .pos file. Examples of valid entry is: phi, h, b, b_reaction, j, jz, jc, power_filaments, power_matrix, sigma_matrix, j_plane, v_plane, hsVal
quantities.title: Quantities

regions.description: List of GetDP region to to write to .pos file postprocessing for. Examples of valid entry is: Matrix, Filaments, Omega (full domain), OmegaC (conducting domain), OmegaCC (non conducting domain)
regions.title: Regions

CACStrandSolve.description: Level 2: Class for FiQuS ConductorAC Strand solver settings

conductor_name.description: Name of the conductor. Must match a conductor name in the conductors section of the input YAML-file.
conductor_name.title: Conductor Name

global_diffusion_barrier.description: Additional diffusion barrier around all filaments together (global).This is created on a line between two strand matrix regions.One around the filaments and the other for the external ring.

CACStrandSolve.title: CACStrandSolve

enable.description: Set True to enable diffusion barriers.
enable.title: Enable

load_data_from_yaml.description: Set True to load the diffusion barrier data from the input YAML-file. Otherwise, the thickness and resistivity specified in this file are used.
load_data_from_yaml.title: Load Data From Yaml

CACStrandSolveFormulationparameters.description: Level 3: Class for finite element formulation parameters

formulation.description: Which formulation? CATI is the default and usual choice to model hysteresis/coupling/eddy currents with the CATI method. AI_uncoupled is a conventional 2D formulation with axial currents modelling UNCOUPLED filaments (and eddy currents in matrix).
formulation.title: Formulation

dynamic_correction.description: With the CATI method, do we activate the dynamic correction?
dynamic_correction.title: Dynamic Correction

two_ell_periodicity.description: With CATI method: True to integrate over twice the shortest periodicity length (recommended), False to integrate over the shortest periodicity length (not recommended).
two_ell_periodicity.title: Two Ell Periodicity

CACStrandSolveFormulationparameters.title: CACStrandSolveFormulationparameters

superconductor_linear.description: For debugging: replace LTS by normal conductor.
superconductor_linear.title: Superconductor Linear

noOfMPITasks.description: If integer, GetDP will be run in parallel using MPI. This is only valid if MPI is installed on the system and an MPI-enabled GetDP is used. If False, GetDP will be run in serial without invoking mpiexec.
noOfMPITasks.title: No. of tasks for MPI parallel run of GetDP

init_type.description: Type of initialization for the simulation. (i) 'virgin' is the default type, the initial magnetic field is zero, (ii) 'pos_file' is to initialize from the solution of another solution, given by the solution_to_init_from entry, and (iii) 'uniform_field' is to initialize at a uniform field, which will be the applied field at the initial time of the simulation. Note that the uniform_field option does not allow any non-zero transport current.
init_type.title: Init Type

solution_to_init_from.description: Name xxx of the solution from which the simulation should be initialized. The file last_magnetic_field.pos of folder Solution_xxx will be used for the initial solution. It must be in the Geometry_xxx/Mesh_xxx/ folder in which the Solution_xxx will be saved.
solution_to_init_from.title: Solution To Init From

CACStrandSolveNumericalparametersPiecewi.description: Level 4: Numerical parameters corresponding to the piecewise source

time_to_simulate.description: Total time to simulate (s). Used for the piecewise source.
time_to_simulate.title: Time To Simulate

timesteps_per_time_to_simulate.description: If variable_max_timestep is False. Number of time steps (-) per period for the piecewise source.
timesteps_per_time_to_simulate.title: Timesteps Per Time To Simulate

force_stepping_at_times_piecewise_linear.description: If True, time-stepping will contain exactly the time instants that are in the times_source_piecewise_linear list (to avoid truncation maximum applied field/current values).
force_stepping_at_times_piecewise_linear.title: Force Stepping At Times Piecewise Linear

variable_max_timestep.description: If False, the maximum time step is kept constant through the simulation. If True, it varies according to the piecewise definition.
variable_max_timestep.title: Variable Max Timestep

times_max_timestep_piecewise_linear.description: Time instants (s) defining the piecewise linear maximum time step.
times_max_timestep_piecewise_linear.title: Times Max Timestep Piecewise Linear

max_timestep_piecewise_linear.description: Maximum time steps (s) at the times_max_timestep_piecewise_linear. Above the limits, linear extrapolation of the last two values.
max_timestep_piecewise_linear.title: Max Timestep Piecewise Linear

CACStrandSolveNumericalparametersPiecewi.title: CACStrandSolveNumericalparametersPiecewise

CACStrandSolveNumericalparametersRotatin.description: Level 4: Numerical parameters corresponding to the sine source

timesteps_per_period.description: Initial value for number of time steps (-) per period for source rotation. Determines the initial time step size.
timesteps_per_period.title: Timesteps Per Period

number_of_periods_to_simulate.description: Number of periods (-) to simulate for the source rotation.
number_of_periods_to_simulate.title: Number Of Periods To Simulate

CACStrandSolveNumericalparametersRotatin.title: CACStrandSolveNumericalparametersRotating

CACStrandSolveNumericalparametersSine.description: Level 4: Numerical parameters corresponding to the sine source

timesteps_per_period.description: Initial value for number of time steps (-) per period for the sine source. Determines the initial time step size.
timesteps_per_period.title: Timesteps Per Period

number_of_periods_to_simulate.description: Number of periods (-) to simulate for the sine source.
number_of_periods_to_simulate.title: Number Of Periods To Simulate

CACStrandSolveNumericalparametersSine.title: CACStrandSolveNumericalparametersSine

source_type.description: Time evolution of applied current and magnetic field. Supported options are: sine, sine_with_DC, piecewise_linear, from_list, rotating.
source_type.title: Source Type

field_angle.description: Angle of the source magnetic field, with respect to the x-axis (degrees).
field_angle.title: Field Angle

CACStrandSolveSourceparametersPiecewise.description: Level 4: Class for piecewise (linear) source parameters

source_csv_file.description: File name for the from_file source type defining the time evolution of current and field (in-phase). Multipliers are used for each of them. The file should contain two columns: 'time' (s) and 'value' (field/current (T/A)), with these headers. If this field is set, times, applied_fields_relative and transport_currents_relative are ignored.
source_csv_file.title: Source Csv File

times.description: Time instants (s) defining the piecewise linear sources. Used only if source_csv_file is not set. Can be scaled by time_multiplier.
times.title: Times

applied_fields_relative.description: Applied fields relative to multiplier applied_field_multiplier at the time instants 'times'. Used only if source_csv_file is not set.
applied_fields_relative.title: Applied Fields Relative

transport_currents_relative.description: Transport currents relative to multiplier transport_current_multiplier at the time instants 'times'. Used only if source_csv_file is not set.
transport_currents_relative.title: Transport Currents Relative

time_multiplier.description: Multiplier for the time values in times (scales the time values). Also used for the time values in the source_csv_file.
time_multiplier.title: Time Multiplier

applied_field_multiplier.description: Multiplier for the applied fields in applied_fields_relative. Also used for the values in the source_csv_file.
applied_field_multiplier.title: Applied Field Multiplier

transport_current_multiplier.description: Multiplier for the transport currents in transport_currents_relative. Also used for the values in the source_csv_file.
transport_current_multiplier.title: Transport Current Multiplier

CACStrandSolveSourceparametersPiecewise.title: CACStrandSolveSourceparametersPiecewise

CACStrandSolveSourceparametersRotating.description: Level 4: Class for Rotating magnetic source field parameters

frequency.description: Frequency of field rotation around z-axis
frequency.title: Frequency

field_magnitude.description: constant Magnitude of the rotating field (T).
field_magnitude.title: Field Magnitude

CACStrandSolveSourceparametersRotating.title: CACStrandSolveSourceparametersRotating

CACStrandSolveSourceparametersSine.description: Level 4: Class for Sine source parameters
CACStrandSolveSourceparametersSine.title: CACStrandSolveSourceparametersSine

CACStrandSolveSourceparametersSineSuperi.description: Level 5: Class for superimposed DC field or current parameters for the sine source

field_magnitude.description: DC field magnitude (T), in the same direction as the AC applied field. Solution must be initialized with a non-zero field solution, either stored in a .pos file, or a uniform field, if non-zero DC field is used.
field_magnitude.title: Field Magnitude

current_magnitude.description: DC current magnitude (A). Solution must be initialized with a non-zero field solution stored in a .pos file if non-zero DC current is used.
current_magnitude.title: Current Magnitude

CACStrandSolveSourceparametersSineSuperi.title: CACStrandSolveSourceparametersSineSuperimposedDC

CC.description: Level 2: Class for coated conductor parameters

number_of_filaments.description: Number of HTS filaments. If 1, no striation case
number_of_filaments.title: Number Of Filaments

gap_between_filaments.description: Gap between HTS filaments in meters. Only applies when number_of_filaments > 1.
gap_between_filaments.title: Gap Between Filaments

material_superconductor.description: Material of the superconductor. E.g. NbTi, Nb3Sn, etc.
material_superconductor.title: Material Superconductor

n_value_superconductor.description: n value of the superconductor (for power law fit).
n_value_superconductor.title: N Value Superconductor

ec_superconductor.description: Critical electric field of the superconductor.
ec_superconductor.title: Ec Superconductor

minimum_jc_fraction.description: Fraction of Jc(minimum_jc_field, T) to use as minimum Jc for the power law fit to avoid division by zero when Jc(B_local, T) decreases to zero.Typical value would be 0.001 (so the Jc_minimum is 0.1% of Jc(minimum_jc_field, T))This fraction is only allowed to be greater than 0.0 and less than or equal to 1.0
minimum_jc_fraction.title: Minimum Jc Fraction

minimum_jc_field.description: Magnetic flux density in tesla used for calculation of Jc(minimum_jc_field, T).This gets multiplied by minimum_jc_fraction and used as minimum Jc for the power law
minimum_jc_field.title: Minimum Jc Field

Cv_material_superconductor.description: Material function for specific heat of the superconductor.
Cv_material_superconductor.title: Cv Material Superconductor

k_material_stabilizer.description: Thermal conductivity of the stabilizer, typically copper.
k_material_stabilizer.title: K Material Stabilizer

Cv_material_stabilizer.description: Material function for specific heat of the stabilizer, typically copper.
Cv_material_stabilizer.title: Cv Material Stabilizer

rho_material_stabilizer.description: Material function for resistivity of the stabilizer. Constant resistivity can be given as float.
rho_material_stabilizer.title: Rho Material Stabilizer

RRR.description: Residual resistivity ratio of the stabilizer. If a list of RRR is provided it needs to match in length the number of matrix regions in the geometry (typically 3)
RRR.title: Rrr

T_ref_RRR_high.description: Upper reference temperature for RRR measurements.
T_ref_RRR_high.title: T Ref Rrr High

T_ref_RRR_low.description: Lower reference temperature for RRR measurements.
T_ref_RRR_low.title: T Ref Rrr Low

Cv_material_silver.description: Material function for specific heat of the silver
Cv_material_silver.title: Cv Material Silver

rho_material_silver.description: Material function for resistivity of the silver. Constant resistivity can be given as float.
rho_material_silver.title: Rho Material Silver

RRR_silver.description: Residual resistivity ratio of the silver. If a list of RRR is provided it needs to match in length the number of matrix regions in the geometry (typically 3)
RRR_silver.title: Rrr Silver

T_ref_RRR_high_silver.description: Upper reference temperature for RRR measurements for silver.
T_ref_RRR_high_silver.title: T Ref Rrr High Silver

Will be taken as a constant as in this model the field dependence is not included (the main purpose of the model is to verify the more efficient Homogenized Conductor model). Including field-dependence could be done but is not trivial because is mixes global and local quantities in this Rutherford model with strand discretized individually as stranded conductors.

MultipoleSolveInsulationBlockToBlock.description:
Level 4: Class for FiQuS Multipole
It contains the information about the materials and thicknesses of the inner insulation regions (between blocks) modeled via thin-shell approximation.

material.description: It specifies the default material of the insulation regions between the blocks insulation regions.
material.title: Material

blocks_connection_overwrite.description: It specifies the blocks couples adjacent to the insulation region.The blocks must be ordered from inner to outer block for mid-layer insulation regions and from lower to higher angle block for mid-pole and mid-winding insulation regions.
blocks_connection_overwrite.title: Blocks Connection Overwrite

materials_overwrite.description: It specifies the list of materials making up the layered insulation region to be placed between the specified blocks.The materials must be ordered from inner to outer layers and lower to higher angle layers.
materials_overwrite.title: Materials Overwrite

thicknesses_overwrite.description: It specifies the list of thicknesses of the specified insulation layers. The order must match the one of the materials list.
thicknesses_overwrite.title: Thicknesses Overwrite

MultipoleSolveInsulationBlockToBlock.title: MultipoleSolveInsulationBlockToBlock

MultipoleSolveInsulationExterior.description:
Level 4: Class for FiQuS Multipole

materials_append.description: It specifies the list of materials making up the layered insulation region to be appended to the block insulation.The materials must be ordered from the block outward.
materials_append.title: Materials Append

thicknesses_append.description: It specifies the list of thicknesses of the specified insulation layers. The order must match the one of the materials list.
thicknesses_append.title: Thicknesses Append

computeCohomologyForInsulating.description: Expert option only. If False, the cohomology regions needed for simulating an insulating coilwill not be computed. This will reduce the time spent for the meshing or more accurately the cohomology computing phase. BEWARE: The simulation will fail if set to False and a perfectlyInsulating coil is simulated.
computeCohomologyForInsulating.title: Compute Cohomology for Insulating

minimumElementSize.description: The minimum mesh element size in terms of the largest mesh size in the winding. This mesh size will be used in the regions close the the winding, and then the mesh size will increate to maximum mesh element size as it gets away from the winding.
minimumElementSize.title: Minimum Element Size

maximumElementSize.description: The maximum mesh element size in terms of the largest mesh size in the winding. This mesh size will be used in the regions close the the winding, and then the mesh size will increate to maximum mesh element size as it gets away from the winding.
maximumElementSize.title: Maximum Element Size

structured.description: If True, the mesh will be structured. If False, the mesh will be unstructured.
structured.title: Structure Mesh

radialElementSize.description: If structured mesh is used, the radial element size can be set. It is the radial element size in terms of the winding's radial element size.
radialElementSize.title: Radial Element Size

radialNumberOfElementsPerTurn.description: The number of radial elements per tape of the contact layer. It can be either a list of integers to specify the value for each pancake coil separately or an integer to use the same setting for each pancake coil.
radialNumberOfElementsPerTurn.title: Contact Layer Radial Number of Elements Per Turn

axialNumberOfElements.description: The number of axial elements for the whole height of the coil. It can be either a list of integers to specify the value for each pancake coil separately or an integer to use the same setting for each pancake coil.
axialNumberOfElements.title: Axial Number of Elements

azimuthalNumberOfElementsPerTurn.description: The number of azimuthal elements per turn of the coil. It can be either a list of integers to specify the value for each pancake coil separately or an integer to use the same setting for each pancake coil.
azimuthalNumberOfElementsPerTurn.title: Azimuthal Number of Elements Per Turn

radialNumberOfElementsPerTurn.description: The number of radial elements per tape of the winding. It can be either a list of integers to specify the value for each pancake coil separately or an integer to use the same setting for each pancake coil.
radialNumberOfElementsPerTurn.title: Winding Radial Number of Elements Per Turn

axialDistributionCoefficient.description: If 1, it won't affect anything. If smaller than 1, elements will get finer in the axial direction at the ends of the coil. If greater than 1, elements will get coarser in the axial direction at the ends of the coil. It can be either a list of floats to specify the value for each pancake coil separately or a float to use the same setting for each pancake coil.
axialDistributionCoefficient.title: Axial Bump Coefficients

elementType.description: The element type of windings and contact layers. It can be either a tetrahedron, hexahedron, or a prism. It can be either a list of strings to specify the value for each pancake coil separately or a string to use the same setting for each pancake coil.
elementType.title: Element Type

turnNumber.description: Winding turn number as a position input. It starts from 0 and it can be a float.
turnNumber.title: Turn Number

whichPancakeCoil.description: The first pancake coil is 1, the second is 2, etc.
whichPancakeCoil.title: Pancake Coil Number

timeSeriesPlots.description: Values can be plotted with respect to time.
timeSeriesPlots.title: Time Series Plots

magneticFieldOnCutPlane.description: Color map of the magnetic field on the YZ plane can be plotted with streamlines.
magneticFieldOnCutPlane.title: Magnetic Field on a Cut Plane

streamLines.description: If True, streamlines will be plotted. Note that magnetic field vectors may have components perpendicular to the plane, and streamlines will be drawn depending on the vectors' projection onto the plane.
streamLines.title: Stream Lines

interpolationMethod.description: Interpolation type for the plot.Because of the FEM basis function selections of FiQuS, each mesh element has a constant magnetic field vector. Therefore, for smooth 2D plots, interpolation can be used.Types:nearest: it will plot the nearest magnetic field value to the plotting point.linear: it will do linear interpolation to the magnetic field values.cubic: it will do cubic interpolation to the magnetic field values.
interpolationMethod.title: Interpolation Method

timesToBePlotted.description: List of times that wanted to be plotted. If not given, all the time steps will be plotted.
timesToBePlotted.title: Times to be Plotted

planeNormal.description: Normal vector of the plane. The default is YZ-plane (1, 0, 0).
planeNormal.title: Plane Normal

planeXAxisUnitVector.description: If an arbitrary plane is wanted to be plotted, the arbitrary plane's X axis unit vector must be specified. The dot product of the plane's X axis and the plane's normal vector must be zero.
planeXAxisUnitVector.title: Plane X Axis

quantity.description: Name of the quantity to be plotted.
quantity.title: Quantity

quantity.description: Name of the quantity to be plotted.
quantity.title: Quantity

position.description: Probing position of the quantity for time series plot.
position.title: Probing Position

time.title: Time Settings

nonlinearSolver.description: All the nonlinear solver related settings.
nonlinearSolver.title: Nonlinear Solver Settings

winding.title: Winding Properties

contactLayer.description: This dictionary contains the contact layer material properties.
contactLayer.title: Contact Layer Properties

terminals.description: This dictionary contains the terminals material properties and cooling condition.
terminals.title: Terminals Properties

air.description: This dictionary contains the air material properties.
air.title: Air Properties

quantitiesToBeSaved.description: List of quantities to be saved.
quantitiesToBeSaved.title: Quantities to be Saved

type.description: FiQuS/Pancake3D can solve only electromagnetic and thermal or electromagnetic and thermal coupled. In the weaklyCoupled setting, thermal and electromagnetics systems will be put into different matrices, whereas in the stronglyCoupled setting, they all will be combined into the same matrix. The solution should remain the same.
type.title: Simulation Type

proTemplate.description: file name of the .pro template file
proTemplate.title: Protemplate

localDefects.description: Local defects (like making a small part of the winding normal conductor at some time) can be introduced.
localDefects.title: Local Defects

initFromPrevious.description: The simulation is continued from an existing .res file.  The .res file is from a previous computation on the same geometry and mesh. The .res file is taken from the folder Solution_<<initFromPrevious>>. IMPORTANT: When the option is used, the start time should be identical to the last  time value for the <<initFromPrevious>> simulation.
initFromPrevious.title: Full path to res file to continue from

isothermalInAxialDirection.description: If True, the DoF along the axial direction will be equated. This means that the temperature will be the same along the axial direction reducing the number of DoF. This is only valid for the thermal analysis.
isothermalInAxialDirection.title: Equate DoF along axial direction

voltageTapPositions.description: List of voltage tap positions. The position can be given in the form of a list of [x, y, z] coordinates or as turnNumber and number of pancake coil.
voltageTapPositions.title: Voltage Tap Positions

EECircuit.description: This dictionary contains the detection circuit settings.
EECircuit.title: Detection Circuit

noOfMPITasks.description: If integer, GetDP will be run in parallel using MPI. This is only valid if MPI is installed on the system and an MPI-enabled GetDP is used. If False, GetDP will be run in serial without invoking mpiexec.
noOfMPITasks.title: No. of tasks for MPI parallel run of GetDP

resistiveHeatingTerminals.description: If True, terminals are subject to Joule heating. If False, terminal regions are not subject to Joule heating. In both cases, heat conduction through the terminal is  considered.
resistiveHeatingTerminals.title: Resistive Heating in Terminals

solveHeatEquationTerminalsTransitionNotc.description: If True, the heat equation is solved in the terminals and transition notch.If False, the heat equation is not solved in the terminals and transition notches.In the latter case, neither heat conduction nor generation are considered.In other words, the temperature is not an unknown of the problem in the terminals.
solveHeatEquationTerminalsTransitionNotc.title: Solve Heat Equation in Terminals

heatFlowBetweenTurns.description: If True, heat flow between turns is considered. If False, it is not considered. In the latter case, heat conduction is only considered to the middle of the winding in the thin shell approximation in order to keep the thermal mass of the insulation included. In the middle between the turns, an adiabatic condition is applied. Between the turns refers to the region between the winding turns, NOT to the region between terminals and the first and last turn. This feature is only implemented for the thin shell approximation.
heatFlowBetweenTurns.title: Heat Equation Between Turns

convectiveCooling.description: This dictionary contains the convective cooling settings.
convectiveCooling.title: Convective Cooling

imposedPowerDensity.description: The power density for an imposed power density in the winding.
imposedPowerDensity.title: Power Density

materialParametersUseCoilField.description: If True, the total field (i.e., coil field plus potentially imposed field)will be used for the material (default).If False, only the imposed field (can be zero) will be used.
materialParametersUseCoilField.title: Use Coil Field for Critical Current

stopWhenTemperatureReaches.description: If the maximum temperature reaches this value, the simulation will be stopped.
stopWhenTemperatureReaches.title: Stop When Temperature Reaches

tolerances.description: Time steps or nonlinear iterations will be refined until the tolerances are satisfied.
tolerances.title: Tolerances for Adaptive Time Stepping

initialStep.description: Initial step for adaptive time stepping
initialStep.title: Initial Step for Adaptive Time Stepping

minimumStep.description: The simulation will be aborted if a finer time step is required than this minimum step value.
minimumStep.title: Minimum Step for Adaptive Time Stepping

maximumStep.description: Bigger steps than this won't be allowed
maximumStep.title: Maximumstep

breakPoints_input.description: Make sure to solve the system for these times.
breakPoints_input.title: Break Points for Adaptive Time Stepping

resistivity.description: A scalar value or "perfectlyInsulating". If "perfectlyInsulating" is given, the contact layer will be perfectly insulating. If this value is given, material properties won't be used for resistivity.
resistivity.title: Resistivity

thermalConductivity.description: A scalar value. If this is given, material properties won't be used for thermal conductivity.
thermalConductivity.title: Thermal Conductivity

specificHeatCapacity.description: A scalar value. If this is given, material properties won't be used for specific heat capacity.
specificHeatCapacity.title: Specific Heat Capacity

IcAtTAndBref.description: Critical current in A at reference temperature and magnetic field.The critical current value will change with temperature depending on the superconductor material.Either the same critical current for the whole tape or the critical current with respect to the tape length can be specified. To specify the same critical current for the entire tape, just use a scalar. To specify critical current with respect to the tape length: a CSV file can be used, or lengthValues and criticalCurrentValues can be given as lists. The data will be linearly interpolated.If a CSV file is to be used, the input should be the name of a CSV file (which is in the same folder as the input file) instead of a scalar. The first column of the CSV file will be the tape length in m, and the second column will be the critical current in A.
IcAtTAndBref.title: Critical Current at Reference Temperature and Field in A

jCriticalScalingNormalToWinding.description: Critical current scaling normal to winding, i.e., along the c_axis.  We have Jc_cAxis = scalingFactor * Jc_abPlane. A factor of 1 means no scaling such that the HTS layer is isotropic.

If this field is set, times, applied_fields_relative and transport_currents_relative are ignored.

SolveSineSourceSuperimposedDC.description: Level 5: Class for superimposed DC field or current parameters for the sine source

field_magnitude.description: DC field magnitude (T) (direction along y-axis). Solution must be initialized with a non-zero field solution stored in a .pos file if non-zero DC field is used.
field_magnitude.title: Field Magnitude

current_magnitude.description: DC current magnitude (A). Solution must be initialized with a non-zero field solution stored in a .pos file if non-zero DC current is used.
current_magnitude.title: Current Magnitude

SolveSineSourceSuperimposedDC.title: SolveSineSourceSuperimposedDC

SourcePiecewise.description: Level 3 Class for piecewise (linear) source parameters for E-CLIQ

csv_file.description: File name for the from_file source type defining the time evolution of current. Multipliers are used for each of them. The file should contain two columns: 'time' (s) and 'current' (A), with these headers. If this field is set, times and currents are ignored.
csv_file.title: Csv File

times.description: Time instants (s) defining the piecewise linear sources. Used only if source_csv_file is not set. Can be scaled by time_multiplier.
times.title: Times

currents.description: E-CLIQ coil currents relative to current_multiplier at the time instants 'times'. Used only if source_csv_file is not set.
currents.title: Currents

time_multiplier.description: Multiplier for the time values in times (scales the time values). Also used for the time values in the source_csv_file.
time_multiplier.title: Time Multiplier

current_multiplier.description: Multiplier for the E-CLIQ coil currents in currents. Also used for the values in the source_csv_file.
current_multiplier.title: Current Multiplier

SourcePiecewise.title: SourcePiecewise

SourceSine.description: Level 3: Class for Sine source parameters for E-CLIQ

number_of_periods.description: Number of periods of ECLIQ power supply [-].
number_of_periods.title: Number Of Periods

number_of_turns.description: Number of turns that conform ECLIQ [-].
number_of_turns.title: Number Of Turns

Succi_fixed.description: Level 3: Class for cable Succi's YBCO fit

Jc_factor.description: This factor multiplies the Jc returned by the function.
Jc_factor.title: Jc Factor

Succi_fixed.title: Succi_fixed

Summers.description: Level 3: Class for cable Summer's Nb3Sn fit
Summers.title: Summers

stack_layout.description: 2D: Tape stack layout ordered TOP->BOTTOM. The numbers represent: 1 = a CC tape, -1 = a flipped CC tape, 0 = a shunt.
stack_layout.title: Stack Layout

nb_tapes.description: 3D: Number of tapes in the stack
nb_tapes.title: Nb Tapes

twist_pitch.description: 3D: Length over which tapes are twisted by full rotation
twist_pitch.title: Twist Pitch

pitch_fraction.description: 3D: Fraction of the twist pitch to be modelled (1.0 = full pitch, 0.5 = half pitch, etc.)
pitch_fraction.title: Pitch Fraction

bare_cable_width.description: Cable width, typically the same as CC width
bare_cable_width.title: Bare Cable Width

bare_cable_height_low.description: Narrow end (if applicable) cable height (thickness), typically the same as (CC thickness + Cu stabilizer thickness) * number of tapes.
bare_cable_height_low.title: Bare Cable Height Low

bare_cable_height_high.description: Wide end (if applicable) cable height (thickness), typically the same as (CC thickness + Cu stabilizer thickness) * number of tapes.
bare_cable_height_high.title: Bare Cable Height High

bare_cable_height_mean.description: Average (if applicable) cable height (thickness), typically the same as (CC thickness + Cu stabilizer thickness) * number of tapes.
bare_cable_height_mean.title: Bare Cable Height Mean

f_superconductor.description: Fraction of superconductor related to the total area of the cable (winding cell)
f_superconductor.title: F Superconductor

f_stabilizer.description: Fraction of stabilizer related to the total area of the cable (winding cell)
f_stabilizer.title: F Stabilizer

f_silver.description: Fraction of silver related to the total area of the cable (winding cell)
f_silver.title: F Silver

f_substrate.description: Fraction of substrate (including buffer layers and silver overlay) related to the total area of the cable (winding cell)
f_substrate.title: F Substrate

f_shunt.description: Fraction of substrate (including buffer layers and silver overlay) related to the total area of the cable (winding cell)
f_shunt.title: F Shunt

f_insulation.description: Fraction of cable insulation related to the total area of the cable (winding cell)
f_insulation.title: F Insulation

f_inner_voids.description: Fraction of additional material (typically insulation) related to the total area of the cable (winding cell)
f_inner_voids.title: F Inner Voids

f_outer_voids.description: Fraction of additional material (typically helium impregnating the windings) related to the total area of the cable (winding cell)
f_outer_voids.title: F Outer Voids

parameter_csv_file.title: Parameter Csv File

tau_scaling.title: Tau Scaling

run_type.description: Type of simulation to run with homogenized conductors (ramp - real cooling conditions, isothermal_ramp - unlimited cooling, quench - non-zero initial conditions)

rohm.description: This dictionary contains the information about the parameters for the ROHM model.
